qas.question: What sort of credentials did Franklin S. Harris have?
Who was responsible for getting BYU acknowledged as an official university?
What was purchased to accommodate more students?
Which president was responsible for the most amount of growth to the campus?
How much did the student body expand under Howard S. McDonald?
What type of degree did BYU's appointed president of 1921, Franklin S. Harris have that no former BYU president had?
Which BYU president was responsible for BYU becoming fully accredited under all major organizations?
What event prompted BYU Pres. Howard S. MacDonald to purchase a portion of an Air Force Base to house a sudden influx of students?

answers.text: the Second World War had just ended

qas.question: How much did the studen body of BYU increase under the term of Pres. Ernest L. Wilkinson to become the largest private school at the time?
How many new LDS Church wards were added during Wilkinson's presidency?
Who saw enrollment of 4540 students at the end of his stay?
Who followed Howard S. Harris as president?
Who reorganized the LSD Church units on campus?

context: <a1_0><a6_0><b10_0>Franklin S. Harris<b10_0/><a6_0/><a1_0/> was appointed the university's president in 1921. He was the first BYU president to have a <a0_0><a5_0>doctoral<a5_0/> degree<a0_0/>. Harris made several important changes to the school, reorganizing it into a true university, whereas before, its organization had remnants of the Academy days. At the beginning of his tenure, the school was not officially recognized as a university by any accreditation organization. By the end of his term, the school was accredited under all major accrediting organizations at the time. He was eventually replaced by <b11_0>Howard S. McDonald<b11_0/>, who received his doctorate from the University of California. When he first received the position, <a7_0>the Second World War had just ended<a7_0/>, and thousands of students were flooding into BYU. By the end of his stay, the school had grown <a4_0>nearly five times<a4_0/> to an enrollment of 5,440 students. The university did not have the facilities to handle such a large influx, so he bought part of <a2_0>an Air Force Base<a2_0/> in Ogden, Utah and rebuilt it to house some of the students. The next president, <a3_0><b12_0>Ernest L. Wilkinson<b12_0/><a3_0/>, also oversaw a period of intense growth, as the school adopted an accelerated building program. Wilkinson was responsible for the building of over eighty structures on the campus, many of which still stand. During his tenure, the student body increased <a8_0>six times<a8_0/>, making BYU the largest private school at the time. The quality of the students also increased, leading to higher educational standards at the school. Finally, <b13_0>Wilkinson<b13_0/> reorganized the LDS Church units on campus, with ten stakes and <a9_0>over 100<a9_0/> wards being added during his administration.
